material.mattext: The transmission of signals over a distance for the purpose of communication is known _____.
The inventor credited with the invention of the telephone is _____.
_____ is the latest generation of mobile communication systems, offering ultra-fast speeds, low latency, and support for IoT devices.
The delivery of communication services, including voice, messaging, and video conferencing, over the internet is known as ____.
____ is the protocol suite primarily used by the internet for data communication.
A network that covers a city or a large campus, connecting multiple LANs within that area, is classified as a _____.
____ is the physical path that carries the signal between the transmitter and receiver.
The network of physical objects embedded with sensors and software to connect and exchange data with other devices is called the ____.
_____ adds an extra layer of coding to differentiate between users and enhance security.
____ carry signaling and control information. Multi-User Detection and Antenna Array Techniques
____ occurs when multiple users transmit on the same frequency channel at the same time.
A ____ correlates the received signal with the known spreading codes of users.
_____ are antenna arrays where the antennas are arranged in a two-dimensional grid.
____ uses digital signal processing to adjust the phase and amplitude of signals.
_____ combines multiple received signals to improve signal quality and reliability.
The _____ detector removes the effects of interference by decorrelating users' signals.
The phenomenon where signals from users closer to the base station overwhelm signals from farther users, leading to detection issues, is known as the _____.
The selection of the best predefined beam pattern for communication is a characteristic of _____.
The arrangement of multiple antennas in a specific configuration to work together is called an _____.
The _____ detector performs interference cancellation from all users simultaneously in an iterative manner. MIMO, High-Speed Packet Access, and Long-Term Evolution
The technique that combines error correction and retransmission to enhance data reliability in HSPA is called _____.
The family of mobile broadband technologies that enhance the performance of 3G networks is called _____.
The gateway in the EPC that routes data between the eNodeB and the EPC is called _____.
_____ is a modulation technique that divides the available spectrum into multiple orthogonal sub-carriers, providing high spectral efficiency and robustness against interference in LTE.
The technique that combines multiple carrier frequencies to increase bandwidth and data rates in LTE-Advanced is called _____.
The technique used in the uplink of LTE to reduce the peak-to-average power ratio, improving battery life for mobile devices is _____.

conditionvar.varequal: SC-FDMA (Single Carrier Frequency Division Multiple Access)

material.mattext: The core network component of LTE, responsible for routing data and managing network resources is called _____.
The full form of LTE is _____.
____ is the technique used in MIMO systems to transmit different data streams simultaneously over the same frequency channel.
The wireless communication system that uses one transmit antenna and multiple receive antennas to achieve diversity gain is abbreviated as _____. Radio Resource Management and Packet Scheduling
The process of distributing network traffic evenly across available resources to prevent congestion and ensure efficient use of the spectrum is known as _____.
The process of determining the order and timing of data packet transmissions in a network is called _____.
The variation in packet delay is referred to as _____.
The scheduling algorithm that balances throughput and fairness by allocating resources based on the ratio of achieved to desired throughput is called _____.
The rate at which data packets are successfully transmitted over the network is called _____.
____ is a variation of Round Robin that addresses the issue of variable packet sizes by using a deficit counter for each flow.
The management of the transition of a user's connection from one cell to another as they move through the network is referred to as _____.
____ is an RRM strategy that pre-allocates resources based on expected traffic patterns and network conditions.
The packet scheduling algorithm where packets are scheduled in the order they arrive is called _____.
The packet scheduling algorithm where packets are assigned to different priority queues based on their QoS requirements is called _____. Multimedia: Image and Video Representation and Transmission
The type of compression that reduces file size without losing any information is called _____.
The integration of text, graphics, audio, video, and animation in digital format is referred to as _____.
A video is composed of a sequence of still images called _____.
____ is a type of video compression that compresses a sequence of frames by exploiting similarities between them.
The one-to-one transmission method where a single sender transmits data to a single receiver is called _____.
The ratio of the width to the height of the video frame is known as the _____.
The number of bits used to represent the color of each pixel is referred to as _____.
___ is a distributed network of servers that deliver multimedia content to users based on their geographic location.
____ is the process of sending digital multimedia content (images, audio, video) over networks.
The widely used image compression format for photographs and web images, offering a good balance between compression and quality, is _____. Competing technologies: Wi-Fi, WiMAX, and FttX
The set of standards developed by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) for wireless local area networks (WLANs) is _____.
FttX networks can easily _____ to accommodate increasing demand for bandwidth and new services.
Optical fiber cables are less susceptible to _____ and environmental factors, ensuring a more stable and reliable connection compared to copper.
The unique identifier for a Wi-Fi network, allowing devices to distinguish between different networks is called the _____.
The latest version of Wi-Fi Protected Access, offering enhanced security features such as stronger encryption and improved key management is _____.
The central device in a WiMAX network that provides wireless connectivity to subscribers is called a _____.
_____ is a device used by the end user to connect to the WiMAX network.
The Wi-Fi standard that operates in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands and offers speeds up to 600 Mbps with MIMO technology is _____.
The wireless communication standard designed to provide high-speed internet access over long distances is called _____.
The FttX architecture where optical fiber is deployed directly to individual homes is called _____. Emerging techniques: MANET and Cognitive Radio
The characteristic of MANETs where nodes can join or leave the network dynamically, causing frequent changes in the network topology is referred to as _____.
The stage in the cognitive cycle where cognitive radios continuously monitor the spectrum to detect idle or unused frequencies is called _____.
The stage in the cognitive cycle where cognitive radios analyze spectrum data to determine available spectrum bands and select optimal channels for transmission is called _____.
The routing protocol in MANETs that uses multipoint relays to reduce overhead in flooding routing information is called _____.
The application of cognitive radio that enables efficient use of spectrum resources by dynamically allocating spectrum to different users based on real-time demand is called _____.

The technology that enables intelligent and dynamic spectrum management by sensing the environment, adapting transmission parameters, and utilizing unused spectrum bands opportunistically is called _____.
The routing protocol that divides the network into zones and uses proactive routing within zones and reactive routing between zones is called _____.
Ensuring that cognitive radios operate without causing harmful interference to licensed users of the spectrum is referred to as _____.
_____ discovers routes only when required, reducing overhead.
The type of routing protocols in MANETs that establish routes on-demand when a node needs to communicate with another node are called _____.
